snippet: Among the large industrialized countries, only Japan and the United States are forecast to grow more than 2 percent this year, and even then just barely.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off The Charts column analyzes report from the International Monetary Fund that found deeply faltering world economy; report forecasts that most large developed economies will either shrink or grow by less than 2 percent, with Japan and the United States as narrow exceptions.
lead_paragraph: Among the large industrialized countries, only Japan and the United States are forecast to grow more than 2 percent this year, and even then just barely.

headline.print_headline: A Global Perspective: More Economic Slowing
headline.seo: I.M.F. Sees Economic Growth Faltering Worldwide
headline.main: A Global Perspective: More Economic Slowing
